TopicTitle: Startup Loading Duration Thread - Post How Long Your Install Takes To Load!

Articles.Content:
My main install took around 20 30 minutes to load the whole game.

How about yours?

Spoiler

My Specs (As what I remembered and knew about my laptop)

HP Pavillion g4, 7 years old ('After-market' upgraded RAM)

  • RAM : 4GB, Unsure of DDR
  • CPU : Intel Core i5-2450M, 2.5GHz
  • GPU : AMD Radeon (HD) 2450M
  • Storage : 500GB HDD
  • OS : Windows 7 Professional

(Will be upgrading to Windows 10 via Media Creation Tool by the end of this year)

My Modlist (I'll list whenever I have time) - Total, 58, as of what AVC logged. Excluding (some) dependencies & MM

  • Making History DLC
  • Breaking Ground DLC
  • Airplane Plus
  • KAX/L
  • SXT Continued
  • APUS
  • Mk2 Expansion
  • Mk3 Mini Expansion
  • Firespitter
  • Stockalike Mk1 Open Cockpit
  • Aviation Lights
  • Grounded - Modular Vehicles
  • ReDirect
  • Tundra Exploration
  • Kerbal Reusability Expansion
  • Station Parts Expansion Redux
  • Tundra Exploration
  • Heisenberg Airships
  • Hooligan Labs
  • Aircraft Carrier Accessories
  • Kerbal Foundries
  • MOLE
  • TAC Life Support
  • BDArmory
  • North Kerbin Division
  • B9 Aerospace (Legacy & Current)
  • B9 Procedural Wings
  • BD Mk22
  • AARS Continued
  • Tweakscale
  • MechJeb
  • Kerbal Engineer Redux
  • Burn Together
  • Kramax Autopilot Continued
  • Kronal Vessel Viewer
  • Janitor's Closet
  • KerbinSide Remastered
  • Kerbal Konstructs
  • Omega's Stockalike Structures
  • Tundra Space Center
  • Crew Light
  • CameraTools
  • Vessel Mover
  • KS3P (Can someone help me to set this up (i.e Getting the visual effect on) pls?)
  • Craft Manager & / KerbalX Mod

It can be among the record-breaking longest to the lightning-SSD shortest ones. Feel free to post yours here.

Edited July 30, 2019 by FahmiRBLXian
@FahmiRBLXian Same as you, around 20 mins.

38 minutes ago, FahmiRBLXian said:

My main install took around 20 minutes to load.

How about yours?

Wow! You must have a pretty big mod list? Or a mechanical hard drive?

52 minutes ago, RealKerbal3x said:

@FahmiRBLXian Same as you, around 20 mins.

Ouch... mine takes 2-3 minutes and I'm putting together a new machine this week, so that time's going to drop a bit.

1 minute ago, purpleivan said:

Ouch... mine takes 2-3 minutes and I'm putting together a new machine﻿ this week, so that time's going to drop a bit.

It takes so long because I run quite a few big mods and have a mechanical hard drive. Having a lot of mods is always a really conflicted experience because you want to get rid of as many as possible to improve performance, but also want to keep them all because they're all so nice, you know?
25 minutes.  SSD, computer less than a year old - all the mods.

Didn't clock it, but seems like around 3-4 minutes?  Definitely not 20+.

Still running an older Mac Mini ( SSD & 16GB RAM helps a lot ), but have a good list of mods ( mostly part mods like Near Future, Planetary Base Sys, etc. ).

Mine is about 4 minutes, ssd, just over 60 mods (some large like rssve).

20+ minutes is absurd, ksp has terrible loading code.

3 hours ago, DStaal said:

25 minutes.  SSD, computer less than a year old - all the mods. 

15-20 minutes for me depending on how many mods in that instance. SSD, 1 year old gaming laptop, 60-85 mods.

Edited June 17, 2019 by panarchist

14 minutes ago, coredumpster said:

Didn't clock it, but seems like around 3-4 minutes?  Definitely not 20+.

Still running an older Mac Mini ( SSD & 16GB RAM helps a lot ), but have a good list of mods ( mostly part mods like Near Future, Planetary Base Sys, etc. ).

I grabbed times from the KSP.log.  It logs when you start, and when you get to the menu.

I'll admit loading KSP wasn't all it was doing - I was browsing the web and watching videos while it loaded.  AVC lists a bit over 200 mods for me, for reference.

On 6/17/2019 at 11:38 PM, Tekaoh said:

Wow! You must have a pretty big mod list? Or a mechanical hard drive?

Yes, 500GB Storage HDD, 4GB RAM, Intel Core i5-2450M, AMD Radeon HD 7450M. HP Pavillion G4.

Approx. 50 mods; around 9 13 of them are part mods, including dependencies.

Edited June 23, 2019 by FahmiRBLXian

Four minute load time for me.

I'm running 36 mods, nine of which are part mods, on a four year old HP laptop.

I'm bumping up against my memory limits so I will be purchasing a new laptop as a Christmas gift to me, just to run KSP.

To paraphrase JFK, ich bin ein Kerbal.

MM

Intel i5 4570, 24GB DDR3 RAM, SanDisk 480GB SSD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 STRIX, probably 4 - 5 years old. Original motherboard, processor and 8GB original RAM, the rest was upgraded later on.

AVC lists 142 mods, which includes 32 part mods, 7 visual mods, and JNSQ. (2.7x Scaled System) Also have Making History and Breaking Ground installed.

Load Time is 10 minutes, 1 second according to KSP.log

54 seconds from double click on the icon to working menu (it would be less but the game hiccups right after the green menu text first appears). This is with 13 extra folders in GameData, off of an NVMe SSD.

I'm also around 20 min or so. About 6 parts mod packs (OPT, OPT Legacy, MKIV, MK2X, MK3X, KPBS). 2 extra planet packs excluding stock (OPM & GEP). The rest are quality-of-life and life support with extra contract packs. I'm on a mechanical hard-drive as well.
Anything more than 3 mins , and i'd chuck  PC off a high cliff

Startup loading, about 5 minutes for the main menu to appear and another 3-4 for it to become responsive.

Exit loading, around 15-20 minutes from KSC to desktop.
How much time it takes you to load the game? Would be nice to hear. Mine with all my mods 1 minute.
Overlapping threads have been merged

Just discovered that my loading duration became longer with waiting to get a functional main menu.

30 Minutes.

If you want to add more mods but get better performance, enable DX11 in your shortcut. (It does add a few barely noticeable graphical glitches though)

Edited July 28, 2019 by RocketSimplicity

2 hours ago, RocketSimplicity said:

If you want to add more mods but get better performance, enable DX11 in your shortcut. (It does add a few barely noticeable graphical glitches though)

I remember tryna do the same thing; adding "-force-d3d11" but without spacing from the location, which resulted in an unsuccessful attempt to apply that. 

Anyway, thanks for shading light on the correct way.

A few minutes(3-5)

I dont have much heavy mods

1.7.0 w/JNSQ, Scatterer EVE

About [1m] and 45 seconds. Another 5sec pause to menu. Full screen 1080p, all settings maxed.

1.7.3 / MH+BG

About 35 seconds, same pause, also maxed settings. 

1.6.1 RO 

About 5 mins.

All from an SSD on an MSI laptop w/8th Gen I5, 1080ti and 16gRAM.

Edited July 31, 2019 by Ratwerke_Actual
Edited [ ]

Maybe 1 or 2? Fast enough I regularly restart to keep it fresh if I'm kerbaling for a long time. 
I've only got about a dozen mods, and I'm running it on a very powerful laptop I set up for CAD work.  SSD, 8th Gen i7, 32GB ram.

Edited July 30, 2019 by Tw1
